dt: {bc}to be or become absent or inadequate
{bc}to be unsuccessful in achieving a passing grade
{bc}to disappoint the expectations or trust of
{bc}to miss performing an expected service or function for
{bc}to grade (someone, such as a student) as not passing

dt.t: The teacher {wi}failed{/wi} only his two worst students.

et: Middle English {it}failen{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}faillir{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*fallire{/it}, alteration of Latin {it}fallere{/it} to deceive, disappoint

dt: usually used in the phrase {it}without fail{/it}

dt.t: Every day, without {wi}fail{/wi}, he has toast and coffee for breakfast.

dt: {bc}a {a_link|failure} (as by a security dealer) to deliver or receive securities within a prescribed period after purchase or sale

shortdef: failure —usually used in the phrase without fail
a failure (as by a security dealer) to deliver or receive securities within a prescribed period after purchase or sale

dt: {bc}incorporating some feature for automatically counteracting the effect of an anticipated possible source of failure
{bc}being or relating to a safeguard that prevents continuing on a bombing mission according to a preconceived plan

dt.t: the little black dress … has consistently been the {wi}fail-safe{/wi} solution for night

shortdef: incorporating some feature for automatically counteracting the effect of an anticipated possible source of failure
being or relating to a safeguard that prevents continuing on a bombing mission according to a preconceived plan
having no chance of failure : infallibly problem-free

dt: {bc}a device or measure that makes something fail-safe

shortdef: a device or measure that makes something fail-safe

dt: often used when someone does not agree with something

dt.t: I {it}fail to see/understand{/it} why we need to change the current system.

shortdef: to not understand —often used when someone does not agree with something

dt: {bc}being a system of grading whereby the grades "pass" and "fail" replace the traditional letter grades

shortdef: being a system of grading whereby the grades "pass" and "fail" replace the traditional letter grades

dt: used to stress that something always happens

dt.t: Every day, {it}without fail{/it}, he has toast and coffee for breakfast.

dt: used to stress that something will definitely happen

dt.t: She promised that she would be there {it}without fail{/it}.

shortdef: —used to stress that something always happens
—used to stress that something will definitely happen

dt: used to say that a person does not know what to say

dt.t: He wanted to express his appreciation for all they had done, but {it}words failed him{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that a person does not know what to say
